p: Taghouti et al. [ 10] showed that the T. mastichina hydroethanolic extract presented a significantly higher scavenging activity of the ABTS radical cation (≈1.48 mmol TE/g extract) than the aqueous decoction extract (≈0.96 mmol TE/g extract). For the hydroxyl radical and nitric oxide radical scavenging assays, both extracts showed a similar capacity for scavenging. These screening assays showed that T. mastichina extracts may be a potential source of phenolic compounds with relevant antioxidant activities, inclusively using the decoction that is the traditional method of consumption.
